positive.review:
Sunkenland sets up its world with a simple premise: water won, and everything familiar slid under. The game asks you to build meaning out of whatever debris you can pull from the sea. What keeps the experience steady is the tension between fragile security and constant need. Nothing feels theatrical; it’s all stripped back to procedure and consequence.

Introduction:
The first moments tell you exactly what you’re working with: limited tools, resources, and a skyline made of half-drowned structures. The setting frames every decision. Supplies are scarce, space is tight, and threats carry no dramatic speeches ; just presence. The appeal comes from how you respond to that structure, not from any spoon-fed narrative.

Examination of core loop:
The game asks you to pull resources from wrecks, patch together equipment, and assemble a base that can actually withstand raids. These steps may look routine on paper, but the atmosphere shifts the routine into something sharper. When you move gear through the waterlogged corridors of a broken tower, you track your oxygen, watch your footing, and rely on simple tools. Nothing feels ornamental. Every action has a clear context: get materials, keep breathing, get home intact.

Base construction:
Building works well because the game gives you enough structure to make choices matter without forcing you into narrow templates. When you fit walls onto platforms, or slot machines into cramped rooms, the resulting structure says something about your priorities. The base is not just decoration; it’s a long-term strategy problem disguised as a workshop.  You can also find decorations such as paintings, neon signs and random stuff like rubber ducks and designer purses to display in your base..which I honestly loved.

Progression and travel:
Upgraded boats change the game’s rhythm. Once you install engines onto a new hull, the world widens. You reach new towers, encounter new groups, and take on supply routes that feel more coordinated. Movement isn’t flashy, but it’s purposeful: distance becomes a planning issue rather than a chore.

Combat and AI:
Combat is serviceable: practical, simple, and sometimes messy. Enemies behave in ways that occasionally break your expectations, but rarely in a way that derails the loop. The rough edges show up, but they don’t drag the experience down.

Systems and limitations:
Inventory friction remains one of the more noticeable Limitations. Some menus require an extra step or two, and item stacks fill up earlier than expected. AI inconsistencies pop up here and there, but they’re more of a side note than a hazard. The game has one Issue that’s worth a clear statement: achievements do not register. It’s annoying if you track Data or completion checklists, but it doesn’t affect the actual play experience.

Atmosphere and tension:
Where Sunkenland stands apart is how it builds pressure without spectacle. You don’t need dramatic music or cutscenes. You just need the sound of a shark brushing past a hull, the quiet of a flooded hallway, or the sight of your half-finished base holding up against a raid. The atmosphere comes from simple Observations: how light hits water, how sound carries, how your tools strain under repeated use.

Co-op considerations:
Playing with others changes the structure of the game. Roles fall into place naturally: one person collects supplies, another reinforces the base, another handles routes. When you pass materials between teammates, the loop becomes smoother and more tactical. It’s a clean example of cooperative systems working through player agency rather than scripted coordination.

Conclusion:
Sunkenland doesn’t try to charm you with speeches, marketing gloss, or staged heroism. It gives you a world, a set of problems, and room to build your own direction. What you take from it depends on how you treat the work: gather parts, hold the line, build something that lasts, and keep going. It’s rough in places, yes, but the roughness fits the Context. The setting is worn down; the systems reflect that; the rhythm reinforces it.

If you want a survival game grounded in practical decisions, quiet tension, and a steady rhythm of risk and reward, Sunkenland holds up well. It’s not polished into sterility, and it doesn’t pretend otherwise. That honesty is part of what makes it worth the time.

I'm excited to see how this game develops over time!

Do I recommend this game? Yes, with a caveat; the game definitely still needs work, the animations are not the greatest, they are there mostly but kinda stiff. The achievements don't work as of this review, and some of the sound design could definitely use work, When you break down items it is quite loud compared to other actions and can make longer sessions less pleasant due to the sheer amount of times you have to listen to the loud banging. It is a fun game overall though, I found it after watching Waterworld and it definitely scratches the ocean apocalypse itch.

interesting game, have vibe of subnautica and rust. can be played solo or with friends or with strangers if you  make server. taking over islands and building a base or multiple bases for multiple groups. enemies will attack you for taking over their islands. melee and guns are okay.

I am reviewing this based on beta version 7.02. It is my understanding that v7 added warships and also many of the points of interest have been updated as well as various other additions and improvements.

Firstly as an early access game this is perfectly playable and well formed and even in the beta version i only found a couple of minor bugs...second time i loaded the game all the points of interest went from being "?" to being discovered which didn't break the game for me and i noticed when taking a full battery out of the head torch it would frequently become half full.

Overall this a good quality survival game with pretty good graphics, systems and mechanincs although there a few things which don't seem quite right...this is early access and the game is actively under development. I have played just over 100hrs and 'completed' the game and mostly enjoyed the experieince, thus it has been great value for money and i would certainly recommend it.

Some improvements i would suggest are;

If you follow the suggested levels of locations the game starts off more as an underwater exploration game and ends up as an island raiding game where by the time you get kitted out for a some underwater exploration with big air tanks and a 'seaglide' (see subnautica) there is no longer any underwater points of interest. The map is actually quite large so there is plenty of space to add more underwater points of interest in the future. The 'seaglide' is most useful kept at your home base in case you die raiding an island so you can get back to the island fast and then just store it in your inventory.

The progression system could do with some tweaking. Looking at boats it is pretty easy to jump straight to the motor boat, avoiding the peddle boat and sail boat all together which are only really useful for their storage space when looting points of interest. The jet ski has no real purpose or niche, seeming slower and less manouverable than the marine fast boat/bowrider and also has zero storage.

The welding torch is kind of a side grade as while it significantly speeds up repairs you can't disassemble with it so still need the hammer.

Every boat you own and island you capture has a marker...which can't be turned off. Later in the game one of the biggest difficulties with combat is your screen full of markers so you can see enemies.

Sniper rifle, with maximum sigh and red dot seems 'iffy' to use. Even my wife, who likes to watch noticed how 'inaccurate' it seemed. In the end i chose to make a high capacity magazine fast firing sniper rifle and use it more like a long range assault rifle, using bursts of shots rather than a 1 shot 1 kill approach.

Will finish with some notable good points;
The game is visually very nice
Weaponry seems solid, with special mention going to grenades...I often skip grenades in shooters as they often seem more like an afterthought and unreliable. After trying grenades in Sunkenland they became one of my go to weapons.
There are some nice QoL aspects for inventory such as being able to move all similar items into a container as well as an inventory sort maching you can make later on.
Can name storage (although does not make an actual lable, just shows the name when hovering over)
great game, an upgrade to stranded deep

Steam needs a 'meh' or 'mixed feeling' review as I don't think it's good or bad, actually I think it has a lot of potential but of course that's where many, many early access games get stuck and die. 

it has a lot of jank, noticeable recurring bugs and the content updates as well as bug fixes come at a alarmingly slow pace.

I would say only buy this if you're okay with the janky feeling and bugs or if you have friends that make it a bit more fun but multiplayer does bring a whole set of new bugs.
great game. has a few bugs. dont bother with planter boxes, they glitch a lot. otherwise its a lot of fun
One of my all time favorite survival games. Just wish there was smokable cigs, cannibalism, and slot machines. 10/10 Indie survival game, with lots of regular, new and fresh updates.

Great survival game with a unique flooded world!

Sunkenland offers exciting underwater exploration, satisfying base building, and intense survival gameplay. Playing with friends makes it even more fun. Very атмосферная игра with huge potential — definitely worth playing!
Excellent game for what it is. No frills, dated graphics, crafting for days.
great game to relax and play. a lot of grinding which i dont mind. has a few glitches like i start to spin randomly but other then that it seems to be great!

I"m not new to these types of games and was upset that i had to spend most of the time looking for food and drinking water to survive, way more than real life.  Also  the backpack space is very limited even after after upgrade and crafting a new backpack , i find myself discarding less valuable items for the more valuables ones. Maybe as the game progresses it gets better and it does get better
love this game a singleplayer Rust essentialy but in/on the water it's good has a lot of potential and i hope the devs keep adding to the game in the current state i'd give it a 7/10 solid.
Definitely recommend with friends! This game would be difficult solo imo. Collect all the scrap you find and build a base asap. Otherwise, we seem to be enjoying it a lot!

Keeping in mind that this game is in early access I think it has a lot of potential. 50 hours in and I'm still having a good time. Sure some aspects are very grind intensive, but that is to be expected with these types of games.  I will admit a lot of the playtime is in the play test version so your mileage may very if you stick to just the base game. They graphics may not be the best but it still has its charm and can still have some very pretty moments. If you are itching for a new survival crafting game I would highly recommend it. at the price point of 20 USD I do not feel as though it owes me anything.  I also excited to see what they cook up if  next if the play test version is anything to go by.

i enjoy the game but i have found that there is an insanely easy duplication glitch in the game and i was able to complete the game under 5 hours. it sucks bc i do like a good grindie type game and the glitch ruins it. thought i just mention it and hope it gets fixed thank you and keep up the great work!!
take some inspiration from raft and make this game even better
very fun game , just needs optimization. really enjoying this game.
v fun and always being updated!
its ok but gets borning fast after a few hours, combat is not there yet, bace billing needs more addons and the abiltey to add you own touch, let us paint the walls and make it look nice.

Overall game is pretty fun which is why i would recommend it. However with cation the dev team is quite slow on updates. At times it feels like they just abandoned the game, then boom a major update launches.
if you like something easy to start its pretty good, not far into it. not a keyboard expert by any means and so far first game i feel i can play without issues.
pretty good game fun with someone you enjoy playing with
great story for survivor
If you like building stuff, then this is for you.
Plenty to do for the price, well worth it.
Pretty good so far!
it's good, I suppose...
Raft and Rust had a baby
Actually pretty under rated
its a interesting game i enjoy it

i would like to start with that i love this game, but the one thing i don't love is that you can only set down certain things on an already an existing island/building. i can set down almost all of the existing builds, but any ceiling accessories like ceiling lights... i cannot place down. why make it where i can place most buildings on the ground but i cannot place a ceiling light on an already exciting building. i have tried putting foundations and pillars but could not put those anywhere in the building as well.
You like punch tree? You like teh loot? Is good game. You like build thing? Is ok game. You like to stabby shoot thing? You like the craft unlock? Is good game.

interesting game, have vibe of subnautica and rust. can be played solo or with friends or with strangers if you  make server. taking over islands and building a base or multiple bases for multiple groups. enemies will attack you for taking over their islands. melee and guns are okay.

I am reviewing this based on beta version 7.02. It is my understanding that v7 added warships and also many of the points of interest have been updated as well as various other additions and improvements.

Firstly as an early access game this is perfectly playable and well formed and even in the beta version i only found a couple of minor bugs...second time i loaded the game all the points of interest went from being "?" to being discovered which didn't break the game for me and i noticed when taking a full battery out of the head torch it would frequently become half full.

Overall this a good quality survival game with pretty good graphics, systems and mechanincs although there a few things which don't seem quite right...this is early access and the game is actively under development. I have played just over 100hrs and 'completed' the game and mostly enjoyed the experieince, thus it has been great value for money and i would certainly recommend it.

Some improvements i would suggest are;

If you follow the suggested levels of locations the game starts off more as an underwater exploration game and ends up as an island raiding game where by the time you get kitted out for a some underwater exploration with big air tanks and a 'seaglide' (see subnautica) there is no longer any underwater points of interest. The map is actually quite large so there is plenty of space to add more underwater points of interest in the future. The 'seaglide' is most useful kept at your home base in case you die raiding an island so you can get back to the island fast and then just store it in your inventory.

The progression system could do with some tweaking. Looking at boats it is pretty easy to jump straight to the motor boat, avoiding the peddle boat and sail boat all together which are only really useful for their storage space when looting points of interest. The jet ski has no real purpose or niche, seeming slower and less manouverable than the marine fast boat/bowrider and also has zero storage.

The welding torch is kind of a side grade as while it significantly speeds up repairs you can't disassemble with it so still need the hammer.

Every boat you own and island you capture has a marker...which can't be turned off. Later in the game one of the biggest difficulties with combat is your screen full of markers so you can see enemies.

Sniper rifle, with maximum sigh and red dot seems 'iffy' to use. Even my wife, who likes to watch noticed how 'inaccurate' it seemed. In the end i chose to make a high capacity magazine fast firing sniper rifle and use it more like a long range assault rifle, using bursts of shots rather than a 1 shot 1 kill approach.

Will finish with some notable good points;
The game is visually very nice
Weaponry seems solid, with special mention going to grenades...I often skip grenades in shooters as they often seem more like an afterthought and unreliable. After trying grenades in Sunkenland they became one of my go to weapons.
There are some nice QoL aspects for inventory such as being able to move all similar items into a container as well as an inventory sort maching you can make later on.
Can name storage (although does not make an actual lable, just shows the name when hovering over)

Every time they have an update for the game I always come back to check it out.  I can spend hours on here and not get bored.  You can customize the settings to best fit you and make several different worlds and start from scratch each time perfecting how you play.
great sandbox, base defence game, good to play co op and generally a great game to just chill out with

GF and me played a good amount of this last year, it was really fun and had decent amounts to do. She enjoyed the base building decorating and gathering, while I enjoyed crafting and doing the fun base gimmicks. I also love that the delevoper makes sure to include lots of base variations, thats something most crafting games forget often going for functiuon over form.

This game is incredibly addictive.  It keeps you wanting to get that next boat or that next gun.  Only complaint is there could be more of everything like animals, sealife, land animals and such.  Hopefully in future updates
great game, an upgrade to stranded deep

A little rough around the edges, but still fun to play. I played this in co-op and haven't had any issues regarding connectivity. No desyncs, no crashes. All in all, the game seems pretty stable. What I felt was missing most were more missions after the tutorial quests. Apart from this, the feeling of progression was fine - mainly driven by exploration, crafting and base building.
The game in its current state has a pretty good amount of content. Definitely fun with friends. Hoping development is not paused because it is very promising

This game is well balanced between time to survival actions time and explore/battles time. The survival actions are not too repetitive or those are repetitive are really quick to do. The progress is well set and we don't have the impress we are doing the same thing for too long.
It is so much fun and more with friends.

I had a lot of fun playing this game. Why can we not remove furniture, like literally why wasn't that added when you guys made furniture? Not being able to edit characters is also annoying. More character settings would be great too. More direction in the beginning stage would also be great.

tons of things to explore and the building is fun

Came back to the game after 2 years off. I played near the initial release and the first several updates. The game has made serious progress since then. It is not clunky, hit boxes are tighter, more customization in the settings, more factions/enemies, tool-tips, and descriptions of items. Been great watching the game grow on discord.

This is a fantastic game!  Its a bit like an expanded subnautica genre, with more crafting, weapons, and enemies.  For $20 you're gonna get a lot of enjoyment out of this one if you're into survival games.
Lots of fun! Crafting is easy in intuitive. Combat is not overwhelming. Land-To-Sea graphics and transitions are incredible!

Writing this from my girlfriend's account right now. We basically built an all second hand parts pc and this game just completely lies about it's minimum specs. The minimum specs are an 8800GT which is older than me almost (lol nah I wish), a Intel dual core CPU, and 8gb of RAM. The recommended specs are a quad core cpu and a GTX 560 with 16gb of RAM. 

We cobbled together a pc with 16gb of RAM, a Ryzen 3400G, and an RTX 3050. This game basically peaks at 40-50fps at minimum settings which is insane. I like the game, but when I came over to play it on her pc I was very disappointed by the fibbing at hand on the specs page.

I like this game. It is fun to play with friends and when it gets updated it does add enough to keep me invested. 
It is easy to navigate, build, survive. But my only gripe is sometimes you get stuck and you get stuck hard. I think maybe an unstuck button would be nice. 
I do feel like the maps are kind of small (Base map), but that could possibly be on myself for just not generating something larger. I would like to see more creatures. The base building is fun. Fighting NPCs is decent, challenging. I do wish the different factions/Island could use some diversity on what is on them. Most of the islands have the same stuff just in varying degrees of difficultly. Maybe the pirates could have something pirate-y only they would have, or the slavers, and so on.
Fantastic water-world style game, love the concept. Would love to see further improvements to the story-line. 7/10.

Love this game so far. It is a good fun and relaxing survival game. I like to gather and build and the enemy factions add to the experience. I hope they continue to develop this game a bit more.  It seems there is potential for improvements or updates. I wish there was a way to automate some processes for example.

4/5 Stars. I like it but given it is early access I give it some leeway. Building system could use some TLC with being able to relocate the actual buildings not just the decorations, workbenches, and storage. However still a good buy and play as I experience it more and it gets updated.

this is a good game the map should much bigger, when you add other players can be restricted from good poi's. the map feel small once players build there own builds. i like to see a friendly fire so the game can be played coop and pvp

Sunkenland is an ambitious survival game set in a flooded, post-apocalyptic world that feels like a mix of Waterworld and Subnautica. After several hours of gameplay, I can say I’m quite satisfied with the experience so far — but there’s still a lot of room for growth.

The world design and atmosphere are impressive, and diving through submerged ruins or exploring wrecks feels genuinely rewarding. However, the game currently offers only a limited variety of fish and underwater creatures, which makes the ocean feel a bit emptier than it should. The AI enemies are also quite weak — they often react slowly or behave unpredictably — yet their gunfire is extremely punishing when it hits, which keeps combat tense despite the simplicity.

Base building and resource gathering are enjoyable and already well-developed for an Early Access title. Crafting feels satisfying, and there’s a good sense of progress as you unlock new blueprints and upgrades. Still, some areas could use more polish, especially enemy pathfinding and the diversity of environments and loot.

Overall, Sunkenland shows great promise. It’s beautiful, runs fairly smoothly, and has a strong foundation for more content to come. For an Early Access game, it’s already engaging and fun, but I’m looking forward to deeper AI behavior, more sea life types, and expanded content in future updates.

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4 out of 5)
Verdict: A solid survival experience with great potential, only held back by some Early Access limitations.
sweet relaxing adventure under water if you like building/looting/diving and swimming around this is the most suitable game for you :D
Definitely improved for the better over time... I enjoy underwater games ;) Sharks could be more of a threat in the water tho...

For 20 dollars it is very well worth what you're getting. Anymore than 30 dollars it probably wouldn't be worth it, Exploration combat and building are neat and refined but a lot of other things aren't so if you have 20 dollars laying around then give it a shot, if you are on a strict budget of 20$ then you can probably find something better.
Fun Game. I would like to see smaller changes, and maybe some fine tuning instead of the complete game changes they have been doing. But, you came always play the older versions

Sunkenland is a bit like $5 Pizza, its cheap, shitty but I am satisfied by it. Its a bit like subnautica with 90% less fish and the difference is made up by human NPCs with really shit ai, you go around an ocean survival crafty looty style and gather materials to bring back to your little 15ft island of your choosing. 

A lot of survival games don't get this right, but there's a reason to explore the whole map, resources dwindle if you raid the same islands over and over so you want to be spreading out and checking new places all the time. The loop of go out, raid, come back, craft, build, go out again, is pretty absorbing.

I'll start by saying that I love everything that this game offers so would recommend based off that. As far as the mechanics in the game however they need some work. A few bugs and glitches but I have a major issue with the furnace and inventory. I feel like it would be fair for whatever is in your hotbar stays when sorting but that isn't the case here when you auto fill to a bin, it takes anything relevant so Im constantly having to fetch my belongings and place them back into my hotbar. The furnace is my biggest ick of this game, the fact we can't put a stack of ore in there to be smelted is horrible. It requires you to have to stand there and do each one individually which takes time away from being able to explore. It would be so much better if you could put 5 ore in and have it run on a timer basis and leave it to go loot then come back to having an output of 5 iron ingots etc. Either way overall this game has so much potential and I will continue to play, just hope it improves over time.
amazing game thoroughly enjoying got a couple of bugs like a death spin but cannot wait to find auto turret blue prints
They basically made a Waterworld game. It's got plenty of flaws, since it's in early access, but it's a lot of fun with friends.

It's an indie game so it feels a bit generic and bare-bones, especially when it comes to art style and combat. It's no Subnautica. 
The setting feels a lot like the movie Water World, which makes base building and trading rather fun. The other thing I appreciate is that there's an actual purpose for having a base, outside of simply being a building/decorating sim. Hostile npcs from neighboring islands will occasionally raid your settlement, and they become more numerous with each attack. A lot of survival games miss the mark there and fail to implement a driving reason to bother with building.
Scavenging under water becomes a bit repetitive and boring after a few in-game days. Dive down, grab up all the metal and wood you can see, avoid schools of sharks (that don't even really roam around, they stay in one spot) and come back up before you run out of air. You CAN technically build under water bases which is kinda cool but at the same time, I'd just go play Subnautica for that because the ocean in Sunkenland just doesn't compare to Subnautica's oceans, which are teeming with life and danger.
For what it is and the price tag, I give it a thumb's up. I've enjoyed it more than the 60-70 dollar turds that some of these bigger developers routinely plop out.

The game is fun when you first start but after a few saves it gets boring. Started playing it in 2024 November as giving up another survival co-op game with a buddy. Yes I totally understand there’s a indie dev but still the new boat update it’s taking it’s to release from early this the leaks and announcements to it still been in beta. Not trying to hate on. The game the building physics alright it just of need to work around with the foundation but I’ve made awesome bases and such. Defeated the game ok insane setting easy after you know you’re way around the game. I personally give 10/10 but as the updates are lacking and legit nothing changed in a year imma give a 7/10 would recommend for the building the items to add to the base a lot to be honest. But other than the islands are easy you build first gun the old bolt action and you can run that on its own you’ve finished the game.

Unsure about whether I would recommend this game as when hosting for my friends and I there are constant connectivity issues the more hours we put in which makes it almost unplayable. It would be ideal if we could share a save file so we could at least see if it's a personal wifi drop or even just to be able to play in a shared world when the main host isn't online.

It's a fun sandbox game and encourages a mix of exploration, defending your base, building and trading so with a few tweaks I would be more than happy to recommend this game to anyone who will listen. I hope that these minor problems will be fixed soon or at least when it's out of early access.
Great balance in difficulty and game mechanics work really well. does what it says on the box.
very good game but it needs a lot of updating and new features in 20h you can easaly beat the game

Time ploughed in at time of writing: 204.8 hours
Would I buy it again? Hell's yeah! 

Its another "I hated it on launch" for me, then during the U.K. heatwave this year, the lure of the cool looking water I saw their insta posts was too much, and I decided to dust it off and give it another go, and I loved every minute of it, faults n all, like instantly hooked.

It's far from perfect, a lot of peeps won't see past the graphics and it not being a super polished game, but its hella fun, not sure about the replay-ability for me, but for what it costs, I more than got my monies worth.

Admittedly raids had to be turned off early doors because I got my ass handed to me repeatedly when my duo was offline, especially when swimming back was our only option hahahaa, even our first lot of waves with of auto turrets and that were full on savage because of the scaling, but we soon got those under control, I like having the option to toggle those.

I love the exploration, the massive sites are a snipers haven, the faster close range combat with shotties is fun, its got it all really, I wish the map had more, I was super sad when we cleared it all.
We haven't dipped back in to try the naval update yet, I'm not entirely sure I'd enjoy that side of it, I'd just be super happy with more islands in the current map and a paid for DLC expansion, maybe elsewhere in the world.

I do wish there were more decorating options, the game is crying out for ivy/vines, I love building in it but the repeating the decor gets a bit boring after a while.

Its a solid yes from me.

Really loving this survival game, graphics are good enough to play for hours,  with much accomplishments the further you progress the better it gets crafting is  straight forward,  getting resources can be a repeat of the same, however needed to build and gain resources.  resources always replenishes  itself   as you play, so never find it difficult to run dry of supplies .    Been playing for hours , music is somewhat  soothing while you play. 
Over all would  recommend this game to any one who love exploring and crafting .

negative.review: played 112hrs and just out of no where it corrupted my game i have lost all my game data and progress, really not happy i had 93 out of 100 achievements unlocked

4.6 hours is about all I can muster to continue playing this. It lacks direction, it's repetitive, world is boring above and below the water, no dynamic weather system to speak of. Gameplay loop is stagnant. Development is like watching paint dry, but they just keep adding fresh coats while doing nothing so it never really dries in the end. 

I'm just glad I got it on sale. I wouldn't pay full price even as low as it is.

this game is called sunkenland, but the only thing that has sunk is this game.

was fun for about 30 mins
It's a hollow game. You get resources to base build and research to get more resources  and build and explore a game with all the beauty of a 2005 first person shooter

So got the game mostly because I saw it was close to "Standarded deep" and in part it is.
and in other ways even better, nice to see guns comes in later. But.
I also wanted to hunt all of does achievements, I saw that there were over 100.
so I was really hype to fight for it, but after learn it was not working, last main version is almost a year ago now.
some devs are mostly likely working on a testing build but still main game has not even just got fix patch.
nothing for 11 months.

Becauseo of does no-working achievements I will not recommend it.
basic false advertising, i was stupid and waited to long before playing and testing.
so my refund window was out, but yeah that's on me.
Hoped the would fix does things, but for me it kinda looks like a dead game on terms of updates.

Pure gameplay is very close to stranded so that's kinda nice.
a bit more diving but it's in the name os it's fine.

There are great difficulty options, except the one that truly matters...
You drop your stuff when you die... I -HATE- this mechanic in games.
Think about it, you died somewhere.... now you need to go back there, without all your stuff, to loot a container, while the things that killed you are still there. Deeply exhausting.

Other than this, the game is okay... there's durability, which I also wish I could turn off, because quite frankly it's just kinda boring to have to keep repairing things. The thirst and hunger, even when turned to low, are pretty wild. Eat 5 crabs in one day? That's enough to fill you up in real life, hell, in real life, that's too much food.... In game however, no. This does barely anything.
Water at least gets sated fairly quickly.

Building is pretty good, You can build fantastic bases. There's a lot of decorations and I definitely made my house too small. But still, my rubber ducks were happy on their bed.
You can plant a bunch of trees to get wood, or just go exploring for wood. I did plant food, but got mad with the game before it gave me anything. And I discovered you can eat raw meat just fine.

The combat is abysmal.... Enemies will snipe you from miles away, with shockingly good accuracy. I had it on easy.... It's possible that I just suck at it... hell, I definitely do... But when you're swimming up to an island, and they're using guns to shoot you, there's not a lot you can do... And then you have to get back to your stuff when you die... They camp your corpse. This is why I won't bother playing the game again, because quite frankly, this just kills the game for me. 

Maybe you'll like the game more than I did, but I cannot recommend it, because quite frankly, I didn't enjoy my time. The base building is good, so if you want to tough out the rest of the game just to build a metropolis, I wouldn't blame you.

Regardless of whether or not you found my review helpful, I hope you have a lovely day. <3

I wanted to give SunkenIsland a chance despite the reviews. Sadly the reviews are accurate. There's nothing engaging about the game and given it's been out for years now you'd expect it to be more polished and complete.

Game is honestly a decent concept, but lack of content and the fact they abandoned Freeman to make this leaves a bad taste. Not to mention they didnt just abandon their old game they also hid under a new alias along side that. KK/Vector3 not a good look guys.
the reivews must be botted because this game absolutely terrible.

this game was awesome day 1. come back to play day 2, changed nothing. didnt even play anything in between day 1 and day 2. i play with a controller and all the buttons have changed, ive tried everything to get them back with no help
The world is dead. It gets boring quite easily
looks terrible, not fun.
another peice of trash that use to be good
Npc's dont respawn? like what....
this ain't it
just bad

I've been playing this game since it came out, had multiple worlds with and without mods. 120 hours later and the game really feels the same as when it first came out. 

Movement, item placement, battle with enemies, and overall actions feels clunky and gritty. Enemies movement don't make sense at times. There's no sneak on enemies unless you're really far away and they all know where you are no matter what happens. 

Items made in the menu or inventory items don't show up unless you exit the inventory. The organization button doesn't make much sense with sorting. 

The button placements on the controller are rough, I don't know how else to describe it as other than being the exact opposite of what the average gamer is used too. There's not enough buttons on the controller so you have to use a mouse and keyboard with or stand alone. 

The game is big, neat idea but empty and boring. If the jank wasn't present with basic movements or weapon attacks it would be tolerable.
Complete Lack of updates and when it is updated always minor changes, just your basic adventure game with not enough content.

I believe I bought this game like two years ago and gave it a test run. Started it up again recently and... nothing changed. It is being updated extremely slowly, there is a constant storage problem even with mods that increase inventory, barely any QoL in terms of inventory, like "store all" or "storage broadcast", so storing all your loot is a hassle, no QoL building stuff like being able to replace wooden foundations with metal ones. And after you reach ores, you're in for even more hassle. I swam around for almost an hour and only found iron and sulfur, with no signs of copper anywhere other than one small vein on starter island, but you need at least 10 of those for the next research tier.
On a plus side, swimming through sunken ruins of cities is definitely a gorgeous experience.

Firsty, Sunkenland really caught my attention, because me and my friend wanted to play something Co-op (we played multiple co op games Forest 1 & 2, It takes two, Split fiction, Rust..) During first few hours, everything was fine, exploring the world crafting basic stuff. 

The problems stared to show after more time in the game. The gameplay becomes repetitve very quickly – arrive at an island, fight NPCs, and thats where the frustration begins. NPC acts like they have aimbot and at the same time wallhack. They can shoot you throught objects. Enemy with a simple pistol call fire a full voley of bullets at the player without any pause (till he reloads), which feels unfair and frustrating. When you arrive at the any island the enemies knows right away where are you and start shooting full blast, throwing grenades etc..  
Also the achievments doesnt work, but it didnt concern me.

I personally ragequit the game, because i didnt see any point why to continue playing. I hope anybody who will play this game will enjoy it more than me and my friend did.

Overall the game is a little clunky but playable.  What  I noticed most about this game is,  there hasn't been any updates on Steam,  since I think, 2024.  Also it states it's been in early access? since August 25, 2023? 

However there has been posts dated July 2025 and August 2025 on steam about a public test branch (hmm...there is a test public branch?) but did the test fixes get added to the early access or just to the public test branch?

I searched around to finally find a website Blog information dated  Sept., assume 2024 since they stopped posting the year on their blog updates,  for the Vector3studio, Sunkenlands.  This blog points players with instructions on how to load the test beta branch in Steam for sunkenlands along with information about the updates for Public Test Branch which are dated 2024.  Also to subscribe for future updates.

While I continue to think Sunkenlands is a clunky good game with lots of potential.  A diamond in the rough.  Many more adventures could be added.
 
However, with all said above,  it gives me room to pause with questions, since we are a couple months away to 2026;  is Sunkenlands on the back burner?  Did the company bite off more than they could chew?

Things just don't add up and I feel this game has been finished in their eyes or sidelined in early access, therefore I can't recommend.  However, if you want to play it for what it is and subscribe to their public test branch you would probably enjoy yourself.
played 112hrs and just out of no where it corrupted my game i have lost all my game data and progress, really not happy i had 93 out of 100 achievements unlocked

4.6 hours is about all I can muster to continue playing this. It lacks direction, it's repetitive, world is boring above and below the water, no dynamic weather system to speak of. Gameplay loop is stagnant. Development is like watching paint dry, but they just keep adding fresh coats while doing nothing so it never really dries in the end. 

I'm just glad I got it on sale. I wouldn't pay full price even as low as it is.

This game is fun for the first handful of hours, especially while playing with friend(s). However, after you start making progress you realize there's nothing to do in this game. The core gameplay loop involves you scavenging and raiding enemy bases, which in theory could be fun if executed properly. It is not executed properly. The gameplay alone feels clunky, which is not a turn off right away. The real issue presents itself in combat with enemy human AI. This is core to the gameplay loop in Sunkenland, and you will fight enemy AI whether you like it or not to progress. The combat is not fun, it feels clunky and not finished. The AI shoot at you through walls, they move in odd ways, they face away from you in combat. It just needs a lot of work, and for something that is core to the game you would think they would want to refine it a little better. 

Through my ranting, overall I do not recommend this game. It needs time and work, and I don't mean to put the developers down, I simply wish to share constructive criticism. If you you're interested in this game, maybe wait until it leaves Early Access, if it ever will.

Was pulled in by the hyped up early early reviews saying this game had huge potential and provided a refreshing spin on survival / crafting...that being said...despite trying to enjoy the game...the game's mechanics / game play loop make it get grindy & boring quick

Like others are saying this game is still in rough shape - and really the problems seem more systemic rather than cosmetic

The game play is overly grindy, the NPCs ridiculously frustrating, the map while initially interesting and refreshing quickly becomes a boring grind

Building - while technically functional - is frustrating and difficult in so many needless ways

Trying to manage your inventory is almost futile and personally think is designed to slowly make you insane
honestly the game is clanky,menus , ui , models even the water everything looks god awful , the gameplay loop is hell boring and i feel like the game is like prototype then a game

First off, the game intrigues me, I see a lot of potential here, but, I see a lot of things that could use work. Granted, this is Early Access, and I'm fine with that, but, in that same breath, there are things that should be a little more polished than they are. Crafting for instance is lacking, in a lot of areas, tell me why I have to by the 'Brick Embryos' only way to get them is through a purchase. You'll let me find black powder, dry at that, and in mass, but can't make a simple brick to build a decent wall. Yeah, not cool. 

Turning raw ore (Copper, Iron) into ingots.. time consuming, or space waste, your call. You need a LOT of room and a ton of wood to pull off a rapid change from raw ore to ingots, because you can only do 1 at a time per furnace. No way to stack and be able to walk away from it and let it do its thing. Not really cool with that.

Now, I haven't enabled mobs, yet, I like to get to the physics of the game, and thus far, it takes too long to get where I'm at, now, that would change if I restart, but.. 

I'll wait and see how they continue to adjust the game and see if they make it more polished as they go along or not, for now, I have to give this a thumbs down, until they give more updates.
add a confirmation button for deleting saves and characters. (its restorable but still very annoying)

I REALLY REALLY want to like this game and it is a really pretty game, however RIGHT AWAY, there are some SERIOUS problems. First off before anything else, the controls make absolutely no sense and drive you crazy. You can rebind them for keyboard, but not for controller. Secondly, the mouse/joystick sensitivity is HORRIBLE and even when adjusted, its crap. The game is gorgeous from my really really short interaction, however I had to drop it in minutes because the controls and sensitivity make no sense. There is no shift transfer for items, jumping with a controller is for some reason clicking with the left joystick and interaction control is the right joystick instead of the left while in a menu, the interaction button on keyboard is by default "F" along with some other controls being goofy, and going even further, you are literally just dropped into this world with ABSOLUTELY no direction. With some serious tweaks including THE OPTION TO REPORT ISSUES OR SUGGEST IN-GAME, I would love to revisit this game and give a better review. Till then, I can not recommend it.

This game has a lot going for it. I look forward to the full release. But as of now, so many game-breaking and just annoying bugs, heck I literally can't even get it to launch on all new hardware.  I have to spend 5 minutes restoring my system and drivers because it completely breaks my OS when I try to launch it in Steam. Every few days I think to myself, maybe it will successfully launch this time, NOPE, there goes 5-10 min of having to to disconnect every damn cable, reconnect everything, and do a full system restore. This is hot garbage at the moment. Will be nice once completed with an actual story and quest mode more than 'jump in the water' quest log book

13 hours later the camera just keeps spinning was prior every 3 hours and restart was fine now the games is unplayable due to constant spinning load in my own world spinning , join another world spinning and multiplayer same issue. went online this is a constant problem. will contact steam for a refund

I can't even play. The game crashes as soon as I try to start a new game. I've tried to reinstall it, use all the beta versions possible, nothing works. My PC/drivers are up to date and it's definitely above the requirements. Asking for a refund...

Hello, long story short: Great idea, bought the game, had fun for five minutes. Then my game turns black. I have all the UI visible, chests and stuff gets displayed, but everything else is just black. I did reinstall, restart my PC, updated & checked all available drivers. Reset again, reinstall again. Everything is just not visible.
Decided to research online, found a bunch of posts about that. Followed every possible way to figure it out. Nothing helped, so I refunded. Kinda sad, looks great. Simply can't play it like this.

game is solid idea is good but performanse and game content is missing big time and instead putting some new content, monument you are adding ships funny and instead focusing perfomance you are focusing on auto turret comon...

This has potential, but I feel the developers are headed in the wrong direction.  Instead of adding more and more boats, their main focus should be on creating more islands, adjusting hit boxes, and god forbid, some form of end game as there currently is not one.  Once you take over the islands, which is not hard by any means, the game just becomes grinding and shooing away the random attack on your base by NPC's that make Gomer Pyle look like a navy seal.
Those who enjoy creating cool decorated bases might find this enjoyable, but I personally think the code making your base look pretty could be VERY well spent in other areas of the game.

Sounds is this game are horrid.    Underwater sounds like a building is collasping over and over.

update 2:
Removed spatial sound, and it seemed to fix the under water issue.   Chopping trees is another HUGE sound issue, and it sounds like nuke went off.

Update 3:
i can't stand it....the sounds in this game are very bad, and the settings show it.  

I played this game when if first cam out, and never had issues like this.
Very empty game with not much direction, not worth buying in its current form

4.6 hours is about all I can muster to continue playing this. It lacks direction, it's repetitive, world is boring above and below the water, no dynamic weather system to speak of. Gameplay loop is stagnant. Development is like watching paint dry, but they just keep adding fresh coats while doing nothing so it never really dries in the end. 

I'm just glad I got it on sale. I wouldn't pay full price even as low as it is.

This game is fun for the first handful of hours, especially while playing with friend(s). However, after you start making progress you realize there's nothing to do in this game. The core gameplay loop involves you scavenging and raiding enemy bases, which in theory could be fun if executed properly. It is not executed properly. The gameplay alone feels clunky, which is not a turn off right away. The real issue presents itself in combat with enemy human AI. This is core to the gameplay loop in Sunkenland, and you will fight enemy AI whether you like it or not to progress. The combat is not fun, it feels clunky and not finished. The AI shoot at you through walls, they move in odd ways, they face away from you in combat. It just needs a lot of work, and for something that is core to the game you would think they would want to refine it a little better. 

Through my ranting, overall I do not recommend this game. It needs time and work, and I don't mean to put the developers down, I simply wish to share constructive criticism. If you you're interested in this game, maybe wait until it leaves Early Access, if it ever will.

Building is pretty good, You can build fantastic bases. There's a lot of decorations and I definitely made my house too small. But still, my rubber ducks were happy on their bed.
You can plant a bunch of trees to get wood, or just go exploring for wood. I did plant food, but got mad with the game before it gave me anything. And I discovered you can eat raw meat just fine.

The combat is abysmal.... Enemies will snipe you from miles away, with shockingly good accuracy. I had it on easy.... It's possible that I just suck at it... hell, I definitely do... But when you're swimming up to an island, and they're using guns to shoot you, there's not a lot you can do... And then you have to get back to your stuff when you die... They camp your corpse. This is why I won't bother playing the game again, because quite frankly, this just kills the game for me. 

Maybe you'll like the game more than I did, but I cannot recommend it, because quite frankly, I didn't enjoy my time. The base building is good, so if you want to tough out the rest of the game just to build a metropolis, I wouldn't blame you.

Regardless of whether or not you found my review helpful, I hope you have a lovely day. <3

Was pulled in by the hyped up early early reviews saying this game had huge potential and provided a refreshing spin on survival / crafting...that being said...despite trying to enjoy the game...the game's mechanics / game play loop make it get grindy & boring quick

Like others are saying this game is still in rough shape - and really the problems seem more systemic rather than cosmetic

The game play is overly grindy, the NPCs ridiculously frustrating, the map while initially interesting and refreshing quickly becomes a boring grind

Building - while technically functional - is frustrating and difficult in so many needless ways

Trying to manage your inventory is almost futile and personally think is designed to slowly make you insane
honestly the game is clanky,menus , ui , models even the water everything looks god awful , the gameplay loop is hell boring and i feel like the game is like prototype then a game

First off, the game intrigues me, I see a lot of potential here, but, I see a lot of things that could use work. Granted, this is Early Access, and I'm fine with that, but, in that same breath, there are things that should be a little more polished than they are. Crafting for instance is lacking, in a lot of areas, tell me why I have to by the 'Brick Embryos' only way to get them is through a purchase. You'll let me find black powder, dry at that, and in mass, but can't make a simple brick to build a decent wall. Yeah, not cool. 

Turning raw ore (Copper, Iron) into ingots.. time consuming, or space waste, your call. You need a LOT of room and a ton of wood to pull off a rapid change from raw ore to ingots, because you can only do 1 at a time per furnace. No way to stack and be able to walk away from it and let it do its thing. Not really cool with that.

Now, I haven't enabled mobs, yet, I like to get to the physics of the game, and thus far, it takes too long to get where I'm at, now, that would change if I restart, but.. 

I'll wait and see how they continue to adjust the game and see if they make it more polished as they go along or not, for now, I have to give this a thumbs down, until they give more updates.
add a confirmation button for deleting saves and characters. (its restorable but still very annoying)

I REALLY REALLY want to like this game and it is a really pretty game, however RIGHT AWAY, there are some SERIOUS problems. First off before anything else, the controls make absolutely no sense and drive you crazy. You can rebind them for keyboard, but not for controller. Secondly, the mouse/joystick sensitivity is HORRIBLE and even when adjusted, its crap. The game is gorgeous from my really really short interaction, however I had to drop it in minutes because the controls and sensitivity make no sense. There is no shift transfer for items, jumping with a controller is for some reason clicking with the left joystick and interaction control is the right joystick instead of the left while in a menu, the interaction button on keyboard is by default "F" along with some other controls being goofy, and going even further, you are literally just dropped into this world with ABSOLUTELY no direction. With some serious tweaks including THE OPTION TO REPORT ISSUES OR SUGGEST IN-GAME, I would love to revisit this game and give a better review. Till then, I can not recommend it.

This game has a lot going for it. I look forward to the full release. But as of now, so many game-breaking and just annoying bugs, heck I literally can't even get it to launch on all new hardware.  I have to spend 5 minutes restoring my system and drivers because it completely breaks my OS when I try to launch it in Steam. Every few days I think to myself, maybe it will successfully launch this time, NOPE, there goes 5-10 min of having to to disconnect every damn cable, reconnect everything, and do a full system restore. This is hot garbage at the moment. Will be nice once completed with an actual story and quest mode more than 'jump in the water' quest log book

13 hours later the camera just keeps spinning was prior every 3 hours and restart was fine now the games is unplayable due to constant spinning load in my own world spinning , join another world spinning and multiplayer same issue. went online this is a constant problem. will contact steam for a refund

I can't even play. The game crashes as soon as I try to start a new game. I've tried to reinstall it, use all the beta versions possible, nothing works. My PC/drivers are up to date and it's definitely above the requirements. Asking for a refund...

Hello, long story short: Great idea, bought the game, had fun for five minutes. Then my game turns black. I have all the UI visible, chests and stuff gets displayed, but everything else is just black. I did reinstall, restart my PC, updated & checked all available drivers. Reset again, reinstall again. Everything is just not visible.
Decided to research online, found a bunch of posts about that. Followed every possible way to figure it out. Nothing helped, so I refunded. Kinda sad, looks great. Simply can't play it like this.

game is solid idea is good but performanse and game content is missing big time and instead putting some new content, monument you are adding ships funny and instead focusing perfomance you are focusing on auto turret comon...

This has potential, but I feel the developers are headed in the wrong direction.  Instead of adding more and more boats, their main focus should be on creating more islands, adjusting hit boxes, and god forbid, some form of end game as there currently is not one.  Once you take over the islands, which is not hard by any means, the game just becomes grinding and shooing away the random attack on your base by NPC's that make Gomer Pyle look like a navy seal.
Those who enjoy creating cool decorated bases might find this enjoyable, but I personally think the code making your base look pretty could be VERY well spent in other areas of the game.

i can't stand it....the sounds in this game are very bad, and the settings show it.  

I played this game when if first cam out, and never had issues like this.
Very empty game with not much direction, not worth buying in its current form

I've been playing this game since it came out, had multiple worlds with and without mods. 120 hours later and the game really feels the same as when it first came out. 

Movement, item placement, battle with enemies, and overall actions feels clunky and gritty. Enemies movement don't make sense at times. There's no sneak on enemies unless you're really far away and they all know where you are no matter what happens. 

Items made in the menu or inventory items don't show up unless you exit the inventory. The organization button doesn't make much sense with sorting. 

The button placements on the controller are rough, I don't know how else to describe it as other than being the exact opposite of what the average gamer is used too. There's not enough buttons on the controller so you have to use a mouse and keyboard with or stand alone. 

The game is big, neat idea but empty and boring. If the jank wasn't present with basic movements or weapon attacks it would be tolerable.
Complete Lack of updates and when it is updated always minor changes, just your basic adventure game with not enough content.

I believe I bought this game like two years ago and gave it a test run. Started it up again recently and... nothing changed. It is being updated extremely slowly, there is a constant storage problem even with mods that increase inventory, barely any QoL in terms of inventory, like "store all" or "storage broadcast", so storing all your loot is a hassle, no QoL building stuff like being able to replace wooden foundations with metal ones. And after you reach ores, you're in for even more hassle. I swam around for almost an hour and only found iron and sulfur, with no signs of copper anywhere other than one small vein on starter island, but you need at least 10 of those for the next research tier.
On a plus side, swimming through sunken ruins of cities is definitely a gorgeous experience.

Firsty, Sunkenland really caught my attention, because me and my friend wanted to play something Co-op (we played multiple co op games Forest 1 & 2, It takes two, Split fiction, Rust..) During first few hours, everything was fine, exploring the world crafting basic stuff. 

The problems stared to show after more time in the game. The gameplay becomes repetitve very quickly – arrive at an island, fight NPCs, and thats where the frustration begins. NPC acts like they have aimbot and at the same time wallhack. They can shoot you throught objects. Enemy with a simple pistol call fire a full voley of bullets at the player without any pause (till he reloads), which feels unfair and frustrating. When you arrive at the any island the enemies knows right away where are you and start shooting full blast, throwing grenades etc..  
Also the achievments doesnt work, but it didnt concern me.

I personally ragequit the game, because i didnt see any point why to continue playing. I hope anybody who will play this game will enjoy it more than me and my friend did.

Overall the game is a little clunky but playable.  What  I noticed most about this game is,  there hasn't been any updates on Steam,  since I think, 2024.  Also it states it's been in early access? since August 25, 2023? 

However there has been posts dated July 2025 and August 2025 on steam about a public test branch (hmm...there is a test public branch?) but did the test fixes get added to the early access or just to the public test branch?

I searched around to finally find a website Blog information dated  Sept., assume 2024 since they stopped posting the year on their blog updates,  for the Vector3studio, Sunkenlands.  This blog points players with instructions on how to load the test beta branch in Steam for sunkenlands along with information about the updates for Public Test Branch which are dated 2024.  Also to subscribe for future updates.

While I continue to think Sunkenlands is a clunky good game with lots of potential.  A diamond in the rough.  Many more adventures could be added.
 
However, with all said above,  it gives me room to pause with questions, since we are a couple months away to 2026;  is Sunkenlands on the back burner?  Did the company bite off more than they could chew?

Things just don't add up and I feel this game has been finished in their eyes or sidelined in early access, therefore I can't recommend.  However, if you want to play it for what it is and subscribe to their public test branch you would probably enjoy yourself.
played 112hrs and just out of no where it corrupted my game i have lost all my game data and progress, really not happy i had 93 out of 100 achievements unlocked

4.6 hours is about all I can muster to continue playing this. It lacks direction, it's repetitive, world is boring above and below the water, no dynamic weather system to speak of. Gameplay loop is stagnant. Development is like watching paint dry, but they just keep adding fresh coats while doing nothing so it never really dries in the end. 

I'm just glad I got it on sale. I wouldn't pay full price even as low as it is.

This game is fun for the first handful of hours, especially while playing with friend(s). However, after you start making progress you realize there's nothing to do in this game. The core gameplay loop involves you scavenging and raiding enemy bases, which in theory could be fun if executed properly. It is not executed properly. The gameplay alone feels clunky, which is not a turn off right away. The real issue presents itself in combat with enemy human AI. This is core to the gameplay loop in Sunkenland, and you will fight enemy AI whether you like it or not to progress. The combat is not fun, it feels clunky and not finished. The AI shoot at you through walls, they move in odd ways, they face away from you in combat. It just needs a lot of work, and for something that is core to the game you would think they would want to refine it a little better. 

Through my ranting, overall I do not recommend this game. It needs time and work, and I don't mean to put the developers down, I simply wish to share constructive criticism. If you you're interested in this game, maybe wait until it leaves Early Access, if it ever will.
